We are all in this together and need to take responsibility for our actions.  Follow the advice of health care experts & the restrictions that have been put in place. Practice safe social distancing to help flatten the curve.  We will get through this, but it will take all of us.

Healthcare workers, police, EMS, social workers, food bank volunteers and so many others are on the front lines. Help protect them.

I cannot not stress this point enough.

Right now we need to ramp up. We need more ventilators, more protective gear and a TREATMENT.

We must slow the spread now!

A friend of mine is on a ventilator and came close to dying the other night.

Someone just suggested to me “We should not be shutting the economy down. Protect the elderly, but young people should be working.” WRONG!!!

We must slow the spread, or the healthcare system will be overwhelmed. We can talk about other ideas in a few weeks.

Stop spreading Coronavirus!           Make it clear to everyone you know. No playing basketball (close contact), no partying, do not go within six feet of others. For everyone that thinks you know better or are invincible. Stop now!

More to do, but he is doing the job we need him to do!

Great job Governor!

During this difficult time, I want to praise @NYGovCuomo  and his team. He and they have done an awesome job. Professional, competent, and reassuring.

Masks, Ventilators, Testing. They are acquiring the necessary supplies.

Whether it's Tibetan Buddhists, Uighur Muslims or students in HongKong, we need to stand up & push back against China for its failure to promote basic human rights. As a member of @CECCgov I will continue to stand up & call out oppression & religious persecution around the world

Sixty-one years later, Tibetans are still demanding independence and the freedom simply to be Tibetan - to speak their language, to practice their Buddhist religion, and to live freely in their own country.

We must stand with Tibet!

Today is the 61st anniversary of the Tibetan Uprising. On March 10, 1959, tens of thousands of Tibetans took to the streets of Lhasa, Tibet’s capital, rising up against China’s illegal invasion and occupation of their homeland. https://t.co/lwmjoXKF20

Like many other bills, such as H.R. 8, the Bipartisan Background Check Act, H.R. 1 is sitting on the Senate Majority Leaders desk gathering dust. It is past time for the Senate to take up this bill for a vote. The American people deserve no less.

This bill includes sweeping reforms to end political corruption & big money in politics, make it easier to register to vote, ensure early voting periods, fight against gerrymandering & my bipartisan amendment to root out & prevent illicit foreign money from entering our elections

Bethpage and the surrounding communities in the plume’s path deserve nothing less than to have this cleanup contained and cleaned now. No more delays.

Today we sent a clear message to the responsible parties that delay will no longer be tolerated. The Bethpage Water District, who has been saddled with this massive burden, has done an incredible job over the years to provide clean and safe drinking water. https://t.co/JI19cOlg3s

I am pleased to report that working together, great progress was made at this meeting which will result in the expedited removal of contaminants from the plume. This meeting was scheduled prior to Newsday’s powerful expose detailing the 40-year history of this site.

...and I have convened multiple meetings w/every stakeholder to hold each party accountable, to try & encourage cooperation & coordination - not finger-pointing. When everything is said & done, we need the Navy & Grumman to pay the money and get the pollution out of the ground.

After 40 years, no more wasting time and money on lawyers and engineers! Put up the money and get it cleaned up!!'

I have worked hard and have had $10s of millions of additional dollars put into the Navy budget for clean up.

Climate change is a real and existential threat. If we act now, there is still time to preserve the future for our children's children, but that opportunity is melting away.

From pulling out of the Paris Climate Accord to drilling in the arctic to removing land, waterways, and endangered species from federal protection; this administration's record on the environment is unfathomable.

As our planet continues to warm, the poles are getting hotter way faster than the rest of the world. Hotter temperatures mean melting ice, which makes sea levels rise, threatening populations and economies around the world.

Ignoring the scientific data that lays out exactly how our climate is changing perils all aspects of life as we know it.
Yesterday, an Argentinian research station in Antarctica posted the hottest ever recorded temperature on the continent - 65 degrees F

It has been more than a year since my colleagues & I in the House passed the first significant gun violence prevention legislation in decades. These bills which could help to save countless lives, continue to gather dust on the Senate Majority leader’s desk.

After years of setbacks, the Merchant Marine Academy is poised for a major turnaround and I am looking forward to working to improve the infrastructure of the campus so it may remain a premier institution for years to come.

As a member of the Board of Visitors of the @UsmmaO  I am proud to have cosponsored this legislation which recognizes the bravery and sacrifice of the more than 7000 midshipmen who fought on our behalf during World War.

This bipartisan legislation will award a Congressional Gold Medal to honor the merchant mariners who proudly served our country during WWII. The medal will be displayed in the American Merchant Marine Museum in Kings Point, here in the 3rd Congressional District.

"Acta Non Verba!” or "Actions Not Words!”

Yesterday, the House demonstrated "Actions Not Words" by the unanimous passage of H.R. 5671, the Merchant Mariners of World War II Congressional Gold Medal Act.

I am a co-sponsor of the Never Again Education Act. This bipartisan legislation will give teachers in America the resources and training necessary to teach our children about the Holocaust and the horrific consequences of hate and intolerance.

Today, as we mark the 75th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz and honor the memories of the 6 million Jews murdered in the Holocaust, it is more important than ever that we come together to fight anti-Semitism and all forms of hatred.

#NeverAgain is, sadly, not assured.

If we do not use the lessons of history to make enlightened moral choices, we risk turning a blind eye to the same hatred and anti-Semitism that formed the permissive foundation for genocide.

I stand with the Veterans of Foreign Wars VFW in demanding an apology from the President for downplaying and diminishing the seriousness of the injuries sustained by our armed forces in Iraq earlier this month.

Traumatic brain injuries (TBI) are one of the signature wounds of post-9/11 warfare. While the symptoms are not always obvious, TBI is always serious. To suggest otherwise hurts our men and women in harm's way.
